criteria.title: Must be available and ready to take incoming call.

examples.text: No- if agent took longer than 5 seconds to answer call
System issues (hardware or software); caller does not respond

criteria.title: Must open the call with correct introduction.

examples.text: Agent does not provide correct introduction, "Thank you for calling Hotel Reservations". -Agent provides a different name or alias.

criteria.title: Must take ownership of the customers request, reiterating the customers issue.

examples.text: Agent does not display understandin of guests request.

criteria.title: Must confirm an provide all relevant information to the owner of the reservation (first and last name, itinerary number, hotel name and booking dates, etc.) before triggering any process.

examples.text: Agent does not complete verification process.
The booking cannot be found or it was not made through HotelPlanner.

Agent set expectations of HOLD times prior to placing caller on HOLD. Responded with updates to caller if HOLD time was going to last longer than originally anticipated. Continued to update the caller and shared steps of the process with them (calling hotel, creating help ticket, escalating to management, etc.)

criteria.title: Must notify the customer of the hold times and dead air.

examples.text: Caller was not placed on hold or caller ended call without waiting for additional steps to be taken

Agent takes control of the caller's issue to guarantee the best solution by offering alternatives for the issue/request expressed; using phrases as "It is my pleasure to help you with your hotel reservations." Thinking outside the box and working with caller to provide an equitable solution

criteria.title: Must explore and find all solutions/alternatives for guest's needs and issues.

examples.text: Used caller's name when addressing them. Only used "ma'am" or "sir" if confident of caller's gender. Spoke in clear, concise English and communicated well with caller. Clarified any confusing language, names, places, etc.

criteria.title: Must sound positive, professional and enthusiastic throughout the call (tone); avoiding jargon/slang.

examples.text: Agent takes correct and complete notes with all necessary information about caller's request and interaction. Indicating caller's reason for the call and summarize steps taken and information provided. Updates FIT notes and creates ZenDesk ticket as required
ONLY use N/A when reservation is not found or a NEW Reservation was Booked .

Agent provided full recap of the nature of the call; reiterated to caller complete, clear and relevant information as to the outcome of their request/issue; clearly defined expectations; properly thanked caller for their call; waited for caller to disconnect before ending call

Agent does not indicate, guide, explain or provide the necessary information for the outcome of the customer's request. Agent ends call prior to agent disconnecting. Agent provides wrong/incomplete/unclear information and expectations.

criteria.title: Must recap the customer of all relevant information, and the possible outcomes of their request setting correct expectations.
